question_sentence: Ninety-year-old Ed Dwight broke a record by becoming the oldest man to do what?
evidence: As a US Air Force pilot in the 1960s, Dwight narrowly missed out on being selected as Nasa's first black astronaut. But now, more than 60 years later, he got to fulfil his dream with a 10 minute space flight on Jeff Bezos' Blue Origin capsule.

question_sentence: OpenAI introduced a new voice for ChatGPT that sounds similar to which celebrity?
evidence: The actor had turned down requests from OpenAI's Sam Altman to license her voice for ChatGPT 4, but was "shocked" and "angered" when she heard the AI system's new voice that sounded "eerily similar" to her own. After her lawyers got involved, OpenAI reluctantly agreed to take down the "Sky" voice.

question_sentence: Which three countries this week announced that they would formally recognise a Palestinian state?
evidence: Norwegian prime minister Jonas Gahr Støre said an independent Palestinian state is the "only alternative that offers a political solution for Israelis and Palestinians alike". Israel has recalled its ambassadors from all three countries.

question_sentence: Who gave a graduation speech at Atlanta's Morehouse College last weekend?
evidence: The US president visited the historically Black men’s college on Sunday to deliver the commencement speech. It was his first time addressing a college campus since the breakout of protests against Israel's war in Gaza.

question_sentence: Which of the following items is not part of the emergency kit suggested by the UK government's new civil preparedness campaign?
evidence: The government's new Prepare website lists the essentials every household should have on hand in case of an emergency. We talk about the campaign, and why disaster readiness is on the agenda, in this week's episode of The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: Why did Elvis Presley’s granddaughter stop the sale of Graceland?
choices: Wants to turn the estate into a hotel
evidence: Riley Keough filed a lawsuit to halt a foreclosure sale of the estate, saying the company purporting to own the Presley home and museum is trying to defraud the family. Keough's lawyers said Naussany Investments & Private Lending is "fraudulently" claiming Lisa Marie Presley used Graceland as collateral on a $3.8 million loan she never repaid.

question_sentence: Newly released data showed that viewers spent a combined 165.2 million hours watching which series in its debut week?
evidence: Series three of Netflix's Regency romp racked up more than 45 million total views over its first weekend on the platform, despite the latest instalment being met with mixed reviews.

question_sentence: Which country recalled its ambassador to Argentina in a row over comments made by President Javier Milei?
evidence: The Spanish ambassador in Buenos Aires is returning to Madrid. This decision comes after a series of comments made by Argentinian president Javier Milei, in which he called Spain's governing Socialist Party "cursed and carcinogenic".

question_sentence: What was the final score in Manchester City's game against West Ham on Sunday that enabled them to retain the Premier League title?
evidence: Manchester City's fourth consecutive Premier League triumph took place under a cloud of controversy, with the club currently being investigated for 115 alleged breaches of the league's financial fair play rules.

question_sentence: Which Supreme Court justice is facing criticism for displaying an upside-down US flag outside their home?
evidence: Supreme Court Justice Samuel Alito said his wife had raised the upside-down flag during a political argument with neighbours but he'd "had no involvement whatsoever." He declined to comment on the "Appeal to Heaven" flag flown outside his beach house last summer.

question_sentence: Which airline was rocked by deadly turbulence this week?
evidence: Severe turbulence hit a Singapore Airlines flight from London. A hospital treating some of the injured passengers said more than 20 people had spinal injuries following the incident.

question_sentence: Which actor said she was angered about a ChatGPT assistant that sounds “so eerily similar” to her voice?
evidence: ChatGPT maker OpenAI is hitting the pause button on one of its synthetic voices, known as Sky, after Scarlett Johansson hired legal counsel over its similarities to her voice.

question_sentence: At which school did President Joe Biden recently deliver a commencement address?
evidence: President Joe Biden gave a commencement speech at Morehouse, one of the country's preeminent historically Black colleges. He told graduates that his administration supports an “immediate ceasefire” in Gaza in a nod to campus protests that have roiled the nation.

question_sentence: Which American restaurant chain announced this week that it has filed for bankruptcy?
evidence: Red Lobster, which brought affordable shrimp and lobster to middle-class America, has filed for bankruptcy. The company said it had more than $1 billion in debt and less than $30 million in cash on hand.

question_sentence: Which country is mourning the loss of its president following a fatal helicopter crash?
evidence: Iran's President Ebrahim Raisi died in a helicopter crash at age 63, the government confirmed. He was the second-most powerful person in the Islamic Republic.

question_sentence: Which property faced a looming foreclosure sale this week?
evidence: Amid a tense legal battle, a Tennessee court ruled Elvis Presley’s historic Graceland mansion cannot be foreclosed upon — for now.

question_sentence: Which company recently launched six tourists to the edge of space for the first time in nearly two years?
evidence: Blue Origin launched six tourists past the Kármán line, an area 62 miles above Earth's surface widely recognized as the altitude at which outer space begins.

question_sentence: What is the traditional retirement age in the US?
evidence: Each day in the US, more than 11,000 Americans reach the traditional retirement age of 65, data shows. This has led to a boom in financial products in the retirement industry.

question_sentence: A 4.4 magnitude earthquake struck the Campi Flegrei supervolcano this week, causing mild damage in which country?
evidence: An ongoing "seismic storm” in southern Italy has sparked concerns among researchers and locals. The last major eruption of the Campi Flegrei supervolcano was in 1538, which resulted in the creation of a new bay on the southern Italian coast.

question_sentence: Which show has aired almost 770 episodes and is nearing the end of its 35th season?
evidence: Now almost 770 episodes in, “The Simpsons” is the longest-tenured animated series ever and the longest-running sitcom in TV history.

question_sentence: When is free parking available in Dewey Beach, Delaware?
choices: Every Monday, excluding federal holidays, from 5 p.m. to 11 p.m.
Every Tuesday, excluding federal holidays, from 5 p.m. to 11 p.m.
Every Wednesday, excluding federal holidays, from 5 p.m. to 11 p.m.
Every Thursday, excluding federal holidays, from 5 p.m. to 11 p.m.

question_sentence: What is the compensation deal for Taylour Tedder, the incoming city manager of Rehoboth Beach?
choices: $150,000 base salary with a $500,000 housing loan
$200,000 base salary with a $600,000 housing loan
$250,000 base salary with a $750,000 housing loan
$300,000 base salary with a $800,000 housing loan

question_sentence: What was the main purpose of the panel discussion held on the 70th anniversary of Brown v. Board of Education in Delaware?
choices: To celebrate the achievements of the Delaware education system
To remind listeners of how closely Delaware is tied to Brown v. Board and how that relevance still echoes
To discuss the future of education in Delaware
To introduce new education policies in Delaware

question_sentence: What was the Cape Henlopen School District’s request in its second referendum of the year?
What is the primary goal of the Diamond State Hospital Cost Review Board in Delaware?
choices: To increase the health care costs
To ensure hospitals align pricing within annual spending benchmarks set by the state
To create more bureaucracy and more cost to taxpayers
To increase the number of hospitals in the state

question_sentence: What is the starting price of the Tesla Cybertruck’s “Cyberbeast” version?
What are some of the new features that will be included in the redesign of the Newark Free Library?
choices: A rooftop terrace and a state-of-the-art performance space
A teen space and designated areas for group study
Sustainable design elements and nearly double the space

question_sentence: What significant change was included in the Wilmington City Council’s revised budget for fiscal year 2025?
choices: A controversial hike in sewage and stormwater rates
A reduction in funding for the HBCU Foundation
A decrease in the city’s tax stabilization reserve

question_sentence: Which of the following statements about the FLiRT COVID-19 variants is correct?
choices: The FLiRT variants are descendants of the KP.2 variant.
The FLiRT variants have caused a significant increase in COVID-19 infections in the U.S.
The FLiRT variants include KP.2 and JN1.7, and they have independently picked up the same set of mutations
The FLiRT variants are less dominant than the JN.1 variant in the U.S.

question_sentence: What are some of the challenges faced by the New Castle County’s Fire Service?
choices: Lack of volunteers leading to rising personnel costs
Inflationary impacts on fire apparatus and equipment
